content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```juliapow WindowManager, Regex

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Define regex pattern to match code blocks
    pattern = r"```julia\s*(.|\n)*?```"
    
    # Use WindowManager for multi-threading to improve performance
    @everywhere code_blocks = RegexMatch.findall(md, pattern)
    
    # Extract the captured groups (code blocks) from the matches
    code_blocks = [match.match for match in code_blocks]
    code_blocks = [match[1] for match in code_blocks]
    
    # Filter out empty code blocks
    code_blocks = filter(!isempty, code_blocks)
    
    # Join the code blocks together with newlines
    extracted_code = join(code_blocks, "\n")

    return extracted_code
end
```
